snippet: For many New Yorkers, an unexpected benefit of Hurricane Sandy was spending time with loved ones.
abstract: Hurricane Sandy caused New York City worlds to collide, forcing residents to connect more deeply with family members, acquaintances and strangers and to experience unfamiliar parts of the city.

byline.original: By PENELOPE GREEN and JOYCE WADLER

lead_paragraph: For many New Yorkers, an unexpected benefit of Hurricane Sandy was spending time with loved ones.

headline.seo: After Hurricane Sandy, Losing Power But Finding a Way to Connect
headline.main: Losing Power but Finding a Way to Connect
headline.print_headline: Losing Power But Finding a Way to Connect
